etymology.description: Pictogram — a person standing on the ground; compare 大 and 文. Also a contracted form of 辛 on top of 妾 and 童; unrelated to 音.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person standing on the ground, yielding meanings like “to stand” and “to set up/establish.” The 立-shaped top also appears as a contracted element in graphs such as 妾 and 童, but it bears no etymological relation to 音.

examples.chinese: 请大家起立(請大家起立)。
我们立了一个新目标(我們立了一個新目標)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen lìle yí gè xīn mùbiāo.

examples.chinese: 他在门口立着(他在門口立著)，不说话(不說話)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài ménkǒu lìzhe, bù shuōhuà.
examples.english: He stood at the doorway without speaking.
